intro: Allionia nyctaginea var. cervantesii, commonly known as the Cervantes's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers, and is characterized by its showy, often bioluminescent flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its flowers, which open at night, attract specific nocturnal pollinators, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and unique features, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
